title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
બહુનામી કૃષ્ણદેવનાં, સુણો ચરિત્ર સર્વે રસાળ<RHYME_209607>; 
ભક્ત અભક્ત કારણે, ફરે હદ્ય બેહદ્યે દયાળ<RHYME_209607>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the character of Krishna Dev as being extremely lovable and endearing, with a charm that transcends all limitations. The devotee's love for Him is so profound that it knows no bounds, not even in death.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
સંતને સુખ આપવા, દેવા દુષ્ટજનને દંડ<RHYME_209608>; 
તેજ કારણ પ્રભુવે, પૃથવીએ ધર્યું છે પંડ<RHYME_209608>.
gujarati.context: To make the saint happy, punish the wicked; this is the divine intention, inscribed on the earth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
જિયાં જિયાં જાવું ઘટે, તિયાં તિયાં જાય જરૂર<RHYME_209609>; 
સુખ દુઃખ ભૂખ પ્યાસનું, નથી ગણતા નિકટ દૂર<RHYME_209609>.
gujarati.context: Life's joys and sorrows are fleeting, while true happiness is a constant pursuit. Suffering or pleasure, hunger or thirst - nothing is as important as realizing the proximity of everything to us.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
પછી એકાએક ચાલિયા, મહાવિકટ અદ્રિ માંય<RHYME_209611>; 
નવલાખ યોગીને નીરખવા, ચાલ્યા પ્રભુજી બહુ ઉછાય<RHYME_209611>.
gujarati.context: As one walks alone, they realize the vastness of their journey; They should take note of their mistakes and seek guidance from the Lord.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ચાલ્યા પર્વત પેખવા હરિ, આવ્યો અતિ વસમો અદરિ; 
જાવા વાટ જડે નહિ જિયાં, જાવું જરૂર પોતાને તિયાં.
gujarati.context: The speaker has left the world to see God and has returned with tears, realizing that one should take care of their own soul as it is essential. The journey to the Lord's abode is long and arduous, but necessary for one's own spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
જાતાં એ દિશે મનુષ્યે વાર્યું, પણ કર્યું છે પોતાનું ધાર્યું; 
ચડ્યા પર્વત ઉપર પોતે, ચાલ્યા શૈલ તણી શોભા જોતે.
gujarati.context: Human beings strive in a direction, but it is their own path they have chosen; they climb the mountain of life and enjoy its beauty as they go.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
આવી નવલાખ ધૂણી રૂપાળી, તે તો સહેજે બળે વણબાળી; 
તિયાં કુંડ દીઠા છે અપાર<RHYME_209617>, ભર્યાં જળ અમળ તે મોઝાર<RHYME_209617>.
gujarati.context: The beauty of a new dawn arises, and with it, the world awakens with gentle ease. The infinite ocean's waves are calmed by the morning dew.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ક્યાંક તાઢાં જળ ક્યાંક ઊનાં, એમ બહુ કુંડ દીઠા નીરુનાં; 
પછી ત્યાંના રહેનારા જે સિદ્ધ<RHYME_209619>, મળ્યા તે પણ આવી પ્રસિદ્ધ<RHYME_209619>.
gujarati.context: In some places, waters flow and in others they stagnate; then those who settle there become famous as well. Those who already are famous also come to that place.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
જેની કોઈને ભેટ ન હોય<RHYME_209620>, મર મોટા મુક્ત યોગી હોય; 
તેને સહુને મળ્યા એકવાર<RHYME_209621>, કર્યા પરસ્પર નમસ્કાર<RHYME_209621>.
gujarati.context: One who has no connection with anyone can be a great liberated yogi; and when they meet someone, they will greet them with respect.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રેમે બેઠા સહુ પાસ<RHYME_209622>, પૂછ્યો યોગીને યોગ અભ્યાસ<RHYME_209622>; 
કહ્યું તેણે તેનું વરતંત<RHYME_209623>, સુણી હરિ હરખ્યા અત્યંત<RHYME_209623>.
gujarati.context: After being seated with love, the yogi was asked to share his yoga practices; he said that God had revealed His secrets to him in an instant.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કહ્યું સિદ્ધને છો ધન્ય ધન્ય, એમ કહી રહ્યા ત્રણ્ય દન; 
આપી આનંદ ત્યાંથી ઊતર્યા, ચાલ્યા હરિ બહુ મોદભર્યા.
gujarati.context:
I have told Siddhna that you are grateful, grateful, and that's what I'm telling the three of us; 
Joy was given to them from there, they went with Hari, being very joyful.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
નવલાખ યોગીને નીરખી, ચાલ્યા હસ્તિ મારગે હરખી; 
ત્યાંથી શુદ્ધ ઉત્તરમાં વળી, રહ્યો રામકોટ ઝળમળી.
gujarati.context: A seeker of truth is purified by walking on the path with a pure heart; from there, one obtains pure wisdom and remains in peace like Ramakot.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં જાવાનું કીધું છે મન<RHYME_209626>, પણ ત્યાં તો ન ગયા જીવન<RHYME_209626>; 
જોતા વન પર્વત વિશાળ<RHYME_209607>, ગયા બાલવાકુંડે દયાળ<RHYME_209607>.
gujarati.context: The mind has been prepared to leave this world, but it still hasn't departed from life. The soul is huge like a mighty mountain, and it's gone to the beautiful valley of Bala Kundan.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
જોયો કુંડ એ જુગતે કરી, ત્રણ્ય રીત્યને રહ્યો તે ધરી; 
વાયુ અગ્નિ જળ ત્રણ્ય મળી, તેના સમોહ રહ્યા નીકળી.
gujarati.context: When three kinds of qualities are balanced, then the soul settles; Air, fire and water combine, and their harmony is reflected.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં રહ્યા પોતે ત્રણ્ય દન<RHYME_209628>, પછી ત્યાંથી ચાલ્યા ભગવન<RHYME_209628>; 
કર્યો અગ્નિ ખૂણે પરવેશ<RHYME_209629>, ચાલ્યા જોતાં જોતાં સર્વે દેશ<RHYME_209629>.
gujarati.context: He lived three days in heaven, then left for the divine; he kindled a fire on earth, and watched it burn in every land.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ગયા ગંગા સિંધુને સંગમે, નાયા તેમાં પોતે જઈ સમે; 
રહ્યા ત્રણ્ય દિવસ તિયાં હરિ, ચાલ્યા સમુદ્ર ખાડી ઊતરી.
gujarati.context: The speaker has reached the confluence of Ganga and Sindhu rivers, where they have merged with their soul; meanwhile, three days passed in devotion to God. They then proceeded to the vast ocean and descended into it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યા કપિલજીને આશ્રમે, જેહ જાયગા સહુને ગમે; 
ચ્યારે કોરે શોભે સમુદર<RHYME_209632>, મધ્યે આશ્રમ અતિ સુંદર<RHYME_209632>.
gujarati.context: Kapilji arrived at an ashram where he felt at home; the area surrounding it, with its majestic beauty, was like a beautiful lake in the middle of the ocean.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
સાંખ્યશાસ્ત્રના આચાર્ય જેહ<RHYME_209633>, તેના ગુરુ કપિલજી તેહ<RHYME_209633>; 
કરે છે તપ પોતે સમર્થ<RHYME_209634>, સર્વે જીવના કલ્યાણ અર્થ<RHYME_209634>.
gujarati.context: The teacher of the Vedas, Kapiljii, is one's own guru; through self-control, one can achieve complete well-being and salvation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
જ્ઞાન વૈરાગ્ય ભક્તિ ને ધર્મ<RHYME_209635>, યોગ સહિત પાંચ જે પર્મ<RHYME_209635>; 
તેના સ્થાપનના કરનાર<RHYME_209636>, એવા કપિલના કર્યા દેદાર<RHYME_209636>.
gujarati.context: Knowledge, renunciation, devotion, and the five Yamas (with yoga) are the foundation of Dharma; those who establish these principles are like the mighty Himalayas, unshakeable.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
રહ્યા ભક્તિ સુત તિયાં માસ, પછી ત્યાંથી ચાલ્યા અવિનાશ; 
આવ્યા પુરુષોત્તમપુરી માંઈ<RHYME_209637>, નીર્ખ્યા જગન્નાથજીને ત્યાંઈ<RHYME_209637>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's faith endures for a lifetime, and after that, it remains eternal; The Lord is pleased with the pure-hearted person who seeks refuge at His feet.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
પછી રહ્યા પોતે એહ ઠામ<RHYME_209638>, કાંયેક ધાર્યું છે કરવું કામ<RHYME_209638>; 
નાય સમુદ્રમાં જઈ નિત્યે, નીર્ખી જગન્નાથજીને પ્રીત્યે.
gujarati.context: The speaker has settled in this world, with a task to complete; they go through the ocean of life every day, seeking guidance from Lord Jagannath.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કર્યું આસન શહેરથી બારું, ઇન્દ્રદ્યુમ્ન સર જોઈ સારું; 
તિયાં દીઠા છે અસુર ઘણા, વેષ લઈ સિદ્ધ સાધુ તણા.
gujarati.context: A good deed done from afar is like an auspicious sight for the gods; many demonic obstacles are vanquished, and a wise man's path becomes clear.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કામ ક્રોધ ને મત્સર અતિ, માંહોમાંહિ છે વૈરની મતિ; 
ધર્મદ્વેષી કપટી ને કામી, વેષ શૈવા વૈષ્ણવી ને વામી.
gujarati.context: Envy and anger are intense rivals, often present in every person's mind. People who are religiously biased towards their own belief system can become cruel and harsh towards others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
મંત્ર જંત્ર જાણે છે અપાર<RHYME_209617>, તેણે વશ કર્યા નરનાર<RHYME_209617>; 
મુકાવી વર્ણાશ્રમનો ધર્મ<RHYME_209635>, કર્યાં ભ્રષ્ટ બગાડી બેશર્મ<RHYME_209635>.
gujarati.context: The power of the mind is vast, it can tame even the untamed person; the duty of a scribe is to write truthfully, without getting corrupted by worldly desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
મોટા મોટા સાધુ સેવા ફળ, કહે દેખાડે નારી આગળ્ય; 
એમ કહીને ધર્મથી પાડે, સાધુનિંદાનું પાપ દેખાડે.
gujarati.context: Great deeds done with a pure heart yield great fruits, says the wise woman. Those who follow their conscience and take a stand are freed from the cycle of sin.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એવા અધર્મે ભર્યા અપાર<RHYME_209617>, દીઠા હરિએ હજારોહજાર<RHYME_209617>; 
ધર્યાં હાથે તીખાં હથિયાર<RHYME_209617>, લીધા ધોકા છરા ને કટાર<RHYME_209617>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

"Great wrongs have been done, but God has forgiven countless times; With hands that hold sharp weapons, one's own doubts are cut down."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ખડ્ગ ખાંડા લાકડી લુવાગ્યું, કર કમાન્યું સલકે સાંગ્યું; 
બહુ બંધૂકું ને કોક બાણ<RHYME_209646>, ચક્ર ચીપિયા લીધા છે પાણ<RHYME_209646>.
gujarati.context: The struggle and hard work done will bear fruit in the end, just like a seed takes time to sprout. Many have labored and their efforts have been fruitful, just as the wheel has turned many times in the water.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
પર્શુ ત્રિશૂળ બરછિયો લઈ<RHYME_209647>, જંજાળ્યો આદ્યે શસ્ત્ર છે કઈ<RHYME_209647>; 
અતિ શૂરા ઇચ્છે નિત્ય યુધ<RHYME_209648>, કેટલાક ન રાખે આયુધ<RHYME_209648>.
gujarati.context: The poet asks why the Lord's weapon is always ready today, just like yesterday; some wish for a daily battle, while others want to preserve their life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કેટલાક ત્યાગી તપ કરતા, કેટલાક સૌમ્ય વેશ ધરતા; 
કૌલાર્ણવ ગ્રંથ વાંચે નિત્યે, પૂજે શક્તિ ભૈરવને પ્રીત્યે.
gujarati.context: Some people renounce worldly desires, while others wear a mask of humility. Some daily read the sacred scriptures, and worship the divine power with devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એવા દીઠા છે નાથે અપાર<RHYME_209617>, મહાપાપરૂપ ભૂમિભાર<RHYME_209617>; 
તિયાં રહ્યા પોતે અવિનાશ<RHYME_209650>, કરવા એવા અસુરનો નાશ<RHYME_209650>.
gujarati.context: The impermanent worldly life is a mere show, and one's true self remains eternal and indestructible. The Lord's intention is to annihilate the demons who try to destroy it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
પણ પોતાથી ન થાય રતિ, કાં જે રાખે છે અહિંસાવૃત્તિ; 
બેસી રહ્યા વિચારી એ વિધ<RHYME_209619>, ત્યારે લોકે જાણ્યા છે આ સિદ્ધ<RHYME_209619>.
gujarati.context: Love cannot be sustained without passion, and even if it is, it will only last until the violence of desire subsides. When one's thoughts are settled, then people know this truth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એમ જાણીને પૂછે છે જેહ<RHYME_209633>, કહે હરિ થાય તેમ તેહ<RHYME_209633>; 
ત્યારે લોકને આવી પ્રતીત્ય<RHYME_209652>, લાવે અન્ન વસ્ત્ર દ્રવ્ય નિત્ય<RHYME_209652>.
gujarati.context: One asks, "What will become of me?" and God says, "If you wish for Him, that's what will happen." Then people come with needs daily, seeking food, clothing, and other necessities.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
તેહ માંયલું કાંઈ ન લિયે, ભૂત ભવિષ્યનું કહી દિયે; 
એમ કરતાં તે એક દન<RHYME_209628>, આવ્યા પાસળે અસુર જન<RHYME_209628>.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that one should not worry about the past or future, and instead live in the present moment; by doing so, one will become a noble and virtuous person.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કહે કર્ય અમારું તું કાજ<RHYME_209654>, લાવ્ય જળ ઇંધણાં સમાજ<RHYME_209654>; 
દઈ ડારો ને બહુ ડરાવ્યા, ન કરવાનાં કામ કરાવ્યાં.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Our work is your duty, we have brought water to society; you should be afraid of the Dāro, but did not take up the tasks that were needed.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કરે કામ જડભરત જેમ<RHYME_209655>, ત્યારે બીજા કેમ કરો એમ<RHYME_209655>; 
તૈયે તે શું બોલ્યા ક્રોધ કરી, એનો પક્ષ મેલો પરહરી.
gujarati.context: As one's own work is done in a hasty manner, so should one hurry to do the tasks of others; otherwise, anger will arise and spoil everything.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એમ વદતાં પડ્યો વિરોધ<RHYME_209656>, માંહોમાંહિ ઉપન્યો કરોધ<RHYME_209656>; 
પછી તેમાં પડ્યાં તડ બેહુ, નિંદા પરસ્પર કરે તેહુ.
gujarati.context: When differences arise, it's natural to resist and argue; afterwards, one's own ego gets hurt, and both parties start criticizing each other.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં બંધાણું વેર<RHYME_209658>, ઇછ્યા મારવા નહિ જેને મેર<RHYME_209658>; 
પ્રથમ તો બોલી ઠોલી થઈ<RHYME_209647>, પછી ઊઠ્યા લઠા મોટા લઈ<RHYME_209647>.
gujarati.context: One should not harbor grudges or take revenge, as it only leads to chaos and destruction. First, calm down and then react with a level head, rather than getting agitated.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
લીધી લડવા પહેલી લાકડી, તે તો પરસ્પર બહુ પડી; 
પછી લીધાં ખાંડાં કર માંય<RHYME_209611>, આવ્યા સામસામા મળી ધાય<RHYME_209611>.
gujarati.context: Initial struggles are like a first rockfall, and then you're deeply entrenched; afterwards, the difficulties become a stumbling block that gets in your way.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
નાખે બર્છિયો બહુ સામસામી, ચાલે લુવાગ્યું ન રહે ખામી; 
સલકે સાંગ્ય ને સણેણે તીર<RHYME_209661>, લડે માંહોમાંહે શૂરવીર<RHYME_209661>.
gujarati.context: When faced with obstacles, one should not hesitate and instead face them boldly. One should fight valiantly, like a warrior, and overcome the challenges.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કરે પર્શુના બહુ પ્રહાર<RHYME_209617>, નાખે ધોકા છરા ને કટાર<RHYME_209617>; 
તીખાં ત્રિશૂળ ચાલે ત્યાં ઘણાં, કરે ઘા ચક્ર ચીપિયા તણા.
gujarati.context: Many people suffer greatly in their lives, but still manage to maintain their balance and composure; just as a skilled warrior can withstand many blows without getting hurt.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
બંધૂકો જંજાળ્યો કોક બાણ<RHYME_209646>, નાખે માંહોમાંહે અસુરાણ<RHYME_209646>; 
એમ જોરે મંડાણું છે યુધ<RHYME_209648>, પામ્યા ત્રાસ આકાશે વિબુધ<RHYME_209648>.
gujarati.context: A crisis has unfolded like a storm, chaos everywhere; calamity looms in the sky.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
બાજે ઢોલ નગારાં જુજાર્યો, ચાયે સામસામી તરવાર્યો; 
તુરી રણશિંગા બોલે શંખ, પડે પાપીનાં માથાં અસંખ્ય.
gujarati.context: In every chaos, there is a chance for growth, and one should be prepared to face the consequences of their actions. The sufferer's head will not be spared, just like the conch shell blows its horn without mercy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
મચ્યો યુદ્ધ રહી નહિ મણા, પડ્યાં પૃથિવીએ ધડ ઘણાં; 
તેને દેખી હરખ્યાં માંસારી, કહે ખાશું આજ ખૂબ કરી.
gujarati.context: A great war is not fought with a weak body, but the earth itself bears many wounds.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ભૂત પ્રેત ને આવ્યા ભૈરવ<RHYME_209663>, પિશાચ યક્ષ રાક્ષસ સર્વ<RHYME_209663>; 
ડાકણી શાકણી ને જોગણી, આવી ભૂખી ભૈરવિયો ઘણી.
gujarati.context: The spirits of the past have arrived, bringing with them demons and all sorts of evils. Hunger and thirst are waiting, like a guest at one's doorstep.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કંક કાગ ને વળી કૂતરા, થઈ ગૃધ્ર શિયાળ ને સરા; 
પડ્યાં માથાં પૃથ્વી પર રડે, જાણ્યું દૈત્ય રમી ગયા દડે.
gujarati.context: A dog wails loudly as its master's time has come, and the earth weeps with sorrow; demons playfully dance in joy, knowing they have won.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કૈંકના હાથ પગ કપાણા, કૈંક નાશી ભાગીને છપાણા; 
એમ યુદ્ધ થયું બહુ પેર્ય<RHYME_209668>, દશસહસ્ર ગયા યમ ઘેર્ય<RHYME_209668>.
gujarati.context:
A hand that takes a step back and gives up easily will be destroyed; the same fate awaits those who compromise their principles.

The struggle has been fierce, with ten thousand Yama's (fears) encircling me.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એટલા તો ઇયાં તળ રહ્યા, બીજા નાશી ભાગી પણ ગયા; 
તે તો દેશપ્રદેશે પ્રવરી, બીજા દૈત્યો આગે વાત કરી.
gujarati.context: They remained steadfast at their place, while others dispersed and perished; then they became the rulers of the land, with others' demonic voices crying out in vain.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
કહ્યું એક હતો નાનો બાળ<RHYME_209607>, તેને જાણતા અમે દયાળ<RHYME_209607>; 
તેને અર્થે વધિયો વિરોધ<RHYME_209656>, મુવા માંહોમાંહિ કરી ક્રોધ<RHYME_209656>.
gujarati.context: I was a small child, known to you as Dyaal; I faced great opposition and anger from within, with tears and wrath.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે અસુર બોલિયા એમ<RHYME_209655>, એને ઓળખીયે અમે કેમ<RHYME_209655>; 
ત્યારે કહ્યું આપીએ એંધાણ<RHYME_209670>, તેણે પડે તમને પેછાણ<RHYME_209670>.
gujarati.context: Someone else's evil words hurt you, why didn't I know; I would have given them a taste of their own medicine and they would have been in trouble.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ ત્યાગી તપસ્વી છે તને, નથી લોભાતો નારી ને ધને; 
રહે છે સમાધિમાં દિનરાત<RHYME_209672>, વળી જાણે છે મનની વાત<RHYME_209672>.
gujarati.context:
The couplet describes a saintly woman who has renounced worldly desires and is content in her spiritual pursuits, where she spends her days and nights in meditation.

She understands the fleeting nature of worldly pleasures and chooses to focus on inner wisdom instead.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એથી પડ્યો પરસ્પર ભેદ<RHYME_209673>, થયો તેણે આપણો ઉચ્છેદ<RHYME_209673>; 
માટે મળે તો મેલવો નહિ, એવી વાત અસુરને કહિ.
gujarati.context: The lines emphasize the importance of unity and harmony between two people, suggesting that even a small division can lead to chaos; therefore, one should strive for togetherness rather than causing separation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એવું સુંણીને બોલ્યા અસુર<RHYME_209609>, હવે ગોતશું એને જરૂર<RHYME_209609>; 
જો મળશે તો મારશું છળે, એમ બંધાણું વેર સઘળે.
gujarati.context: The demon has been asked to surrender now, as it's necessary; if found, I'll take revenge on all, that's my promise.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એમ દૈત્યે કર્યું પરિયાણ<RHYME_209676>, તેને જાણે છે હરિ સુજાણ<RHYME_209676>; 
કહે છે જેમ થશે તેમ ઠીક<RHYME_209677>, નથી આત્માને કેની બીક<RHYME_209677>.
gujarati.context: The demon's fate was decided, and God knows it; what will happen, that is true, but no one can know the future of their own soul.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી જોયું તતખેવ<RHYME_209678>, દીઠા દૈવી સંપત્તિના જીવ<RHYME_209678>; 
તેને પોતે ઉપદેશ આપી, કર્યા સુખી ભવદુઃખ કાપી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1 to 2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

"Know that the wealth and prosperity one enjoys in this life are granted by God; He Himself advises us, cutting off our suffering from birth."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
આ જે હરિચરિત્ર અનુપ<RHYME_209680>, કૃષ્ણભક્તને છે સુખરૂપ<RHYME_209680>; 
તેને કહેશે સાંભળશે જેહ<RHYME_209633>, મહાકષ્ટથી મુકાશે તેહ<RHYME_209633>.
gujarati.context: He who is fortunate to have the company of Krishna's devotees is blessed with joy; his troubles will be washed away like a stone in the mighty Ganges River.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
આ લોકમાં પણ સુખી રહેશે, પરલોકે પરમસુખ લેશે; 
પાપહરણી કથા છે પવિત્ર<RHYME_209682>, જેમાં પ્રકટ પ્રભુનાં ચરિત્ર<RHYME_209682>.
gujarati.context:
One can be happy in this world and also take happiness to the afterlife, for it is a sacred story of God's character.

In both worlds, one will find bliss.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત હશે તે સુણશે ભાવે, અભક્તને અર્થ નહી આવે; 
કહેશે હેતે સાંભળશે કાન<RHYME_209684>, તે પર રાજી થાશે ભગવાન<RHYME_209684>.
gujarati.context: A devotee will understand the divine emotions, while an undevotee will not comprehend the meaning; and if one listens to the message of God, they will eventually attain peace.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 33: Shrī Haricharitra - Navlakh Yoginu Kalyan

transliteration.couplet:
Bahunāmī Kṛuṣhṇadevnā, suṇo charitra sarve rasāḷ; <RHYME_1>
Bhakta abhakta kāraṇe, fare hadya behadye dayāḷ.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The story of Lord Krishna is the sole source of joy and inspiration for all devotees; his divine play is a cause for equal happiness in both the devoted and those who are not.

transliteration.couplet:
Santne sukh āpavā, devā duṣhṭajanne danḍ; <RHYME_2>
Tej kāraṇ Prabhuve, pṛuthavīe dharyu chhe panḍ.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: God's pleasure is in the happiness of the devotees, and He gives them a share from His own treasury. The Lord's power is such that it can even support the earth, not to mention others.

transliteration.couplet:
Jiyā jiyā jāvu ghaṭe, tiyā tiyā jāy jarūr; <RHYME_3>
Sukh dukh bhūkh pyāsnu, nathī gaṇatā nikaṭ dūr.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context:
As one lives and grows old, so will one eventually meet their end; happiness and sorrow are close at hand, just a step away.

(Note: The couplet is suggesting the fleeting nature of life and how both joy and sadness are immediate possibilities.)

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī ekā-ek chāliyā, mahāvikaṭ adri māy; <RHYME_4>
Navlākh yogīne nīrakhavā, chālyā Prabhujī bahu uchhāy.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: One step at a time, I slowly climb the great mountain of self-realization; With each step, my soul rises to meet God's abode.

transliteration.couplet:
Chālyā parvat pekhavā Hari, āvyo ati vasamo adari; <RHYME_5>
Jāvā vāṭ jaḍe nahi jiyā, jāvu jarūr potāne tiyā.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context:
Lord Hari lives in the mountain peaks, yet is always near; one who does not live in worldly attachment will definitely reach spiritual heights.

One who is not attached to earthly pleasures will surely reach spiritual realization.

transliteration.couplet:
Jātā e dishe manuṣhye vāryu, paṇ karyu chhe potānu dhāryu; <RHYME_6>
Chaḍyā parvat upar pote, chālyā shail taṇī shobhā jote.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: As the world moves forward, one's thoughts are always ahead of time; like a mountain peak, one's future is forever bright and beautiful.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī navlākh dhūṇī rūpāḷī, te to saheje baḷe vaṇbāḷī; <RHYME_7>
Tiyā kunḍ dīṭhā chhe apār, bharyā jaḷ amaḷ te mozār.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a woman's patience and endurance in her marriage, likening it to the fragility of a small spark that can still light up a dark room. Despite her partner being careless and thoughtless, she remains tolerant and accommodative.

transliteration.couplet:
Kyāk tāḍhā jaḷ kyāk ūnā, em bahu kunḍ dīṭhā nīrunā; <RHYME_8>
Pachhī tyānā rahenārā je siddha, maḷyā te paṇ āvī prasiddha.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: As you reach the peak of success, others may envy and try to bring you down; but those who have achieved their goals are already famous and beyond such petty attempts.

transliteration.couplet:
Jenī koīne bheṭ na hoy, mar moṭā mukta yogī hoy; <RHYME_9>
Tene sahune maḷyā ekvār, karyā paraspar namaskār.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: A true yogi is not one who has not eaten anything, but rather one whose soul is free and unbound. One's own soul is the only worship-worthy thing, and we should bow down to it in every moment.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī preme beṭhā sahu pās, pūchhyo yogīne yog abhyās; <RHYME_10>
Kahyu teṇe tenu varatant, suṇī Hari harakhyā atyant.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: One should first purify the mind and then seek spiritual practices. The pursuit of self-realization is essential to attain ultimate liberation.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahyu siddhane chho dhanya dhanya, em kahī rahyā traṇya dan; <RHYME_11>
Āpī ānand tyāthī ūtaryā, chālyā Hari bahu modbharyā.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The fortunate one has reached their goal with joy and gratitude, receiving the divine's blessings. Their happiness is overflowing as they chant God's name with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Navlākh yogīne nīrakhī, chālyā hasti mārage harakhī; <RHYME_12>
Tyāthī shuddha uttarmā vaḷī, rahyo Rāmkoṭ zaḷmaḷī.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context:
The yogi's attention is focused on the divine, not swayed by worldly desires; his soul has reached the pure and sacred realm of God.

In a state of spiritual purity, he remains forever immersed in the bliss of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā jāvānu kīdhu chhe man, paṇ tyā to na gayā jīvan; <RHYME_13>
Jotā van parvat vishāḷ, gayā bālavākunḍe dayāḷ.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: Life is like a journey that's ended soon, and we haven't even lived it yet. Just like a mountain range has a peak to reach, our path has its own challenges and mercies.

transliteration.couplet:
Joyo kunḍ e jugate karī, traṇya rītyane rahyo te dharī; <RHYME_14>
Vāyu agni jaḷ traṇya maḷī, tenā samoh rahyā nīkaḷī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: Enjoy the joys of life's journey with enthusiasm and vigor; let your worries be swept away like autumn leaves by the wind and fire.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā rahyā pote traṇya dan, pachhī tyāthī chālyā Bhagwan; <RHYME_15>
Karyo agni khūṇe paravesh, chālyā jotā jotā sarve desh.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the idea that one should have complete devotion to God (Bhagwan) and surrender their actions and desires, just like a bird leaving its nest (tyāthī chālyā). This devotion can purify even the darkest of deeds, shining bright like a beacon across all lands.

transliteration.couplet:
Gayā Gangā Sindhune sangame, nāyā temā pote jaī same; <RHYME_16>
Rahyā traṇya divas tiyā Hari, chālyā samudra khāḍī ūtarī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context:
At the confluence of Ganga and Sindhu rivers, one's soul is freed from worldly attachments; then, like the sea, one's ego subsides with the passing of time.

One's attachment to the world lasts only a day or night, but with God, it's forever.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā Kapiljīne āshrame, jeh jāyagā sahune game; <RHYME_17>
Chyāre kore shobhe samudar, madhye āshram ati sundar.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: In Kapil's ashram, one finds solace and peace; amidst the beautiful surroundings of Samudra lake.

transliteration.couplet:
Sānkhya-Shāstranā āchārya jeh, tenā guru Kapiljī teh; <RHYME_18>
Kare chhe tap pote samarth, sarve jīvnā kalyāṇ arth.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet refers to Sage Kapil as the guru of Sānkhya-Shāstranā and praises his capability to purify others through spiritual practices, ultimately leading to their well-being.

transliteration.couplet:
Gnān vairāgya bhakti ne dharma, yog sahit pānch je parma; <RHYME_19>
Tenā sthāpannā karanār, evā Kapilnā karyā dedār.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The couplet highlights the importance of knowledge (Gnān), detachment (vairāgya) and devotion (bhakti) as the foundation for a person's spiritual journey. These three elements, along with yoga, are essential to achieving one's highest potential.

transliteration.couplet:
Rahyā Bhakti sut tiyā mās, pachhī tyāthī chālyā avināsh; <RHYME_20>
Āvyā Puruṣhottampurī māī, nīrkhyā Jagannāthjīne tyāī.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The devotion of a true devotee is like an endless ocean, without a shore or end. The Lord's love for them is so strong that it goes beyond the limits of time and space.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī rahyā pote eh ṭhām, kāyek dhāryu chhe karavu kām; <RHYME_21>
Nāy samudramā jaī nitye, nīrkhī Jagannāthjīne prītye.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the ocean's eternal longing for the Lord Jagannath, which is likened to a wife's love for her husband.

transliteration.couplet:
Karyu āsan shaherthī bāru, Indradyumna sar joī sāru; <RHYME_22>
Tiyā dīṭhā chhe asur ghaṇā, veṣh laī siddha sādhu taṇā.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The city is filled with people who are busy doing their work, just like Indradyumna who is engaged in his own tasks; meanwhile, the demons are wandering around aimlessly, seeking spiritual guidance from the saints.

transliteration.couplet:
Kām krodh ne matsar ati, māhomāhi chhe vairnī mati; <RHYME_23>
Dharmadveṣhī kapaṭī ne kāmī, veṣh Shaivā Vaiṣhṇavī ne Vāmī.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: Pride and passion lead to anger, while spiritual intelligence brings peace; righteousness is corrupted by desire, regardless of Vaishnavism or Shaivism.

transliteration.couplet:
Mantra jantra jāṇe chhe apār, teṇe vash karyā nar-nār; <RHYME_24>
Mukāvī varṇāshramno dharma, karyā bhraṣhṭa bagāḍī besharma.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: A person with spiritual knowledge and understanding is superior to others, and they can guide people towards good deeds; it's essential to follow one's own duty and principles.

transliteration.couplet:
Moṭā moṭā sādhu sevā faḷ, kahe dekhāḍe nārī āgaḷya; <RHYME_25>
Em kahīne dharmathī pāḍe, sādhu-nindānu pāp dekhāḍe.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context:
A devotee's service is pure and selfless, a virtuous woman's love shines like the sun; without faith, one falls into sin and shame.

Devotion to duty cleanses one's soul, while speaking ill of saints brings about sin and guilt.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā adharme bharyā apār, dīṭhā Harie hajāro-hajār; <RHYME_26>
Dharyā hāthe tīkhā hathiyār, līdhā dhokā chharā ne kaṭār.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person who is extremely evil and cruel, with no bounds or limits in their wrongdoing. Their wickedness is like a sharp knife that cuts through everything in its path.

transliteration.couplet:
Khaḍga khānḍā lākaḍī luvāgyu, kar kamānyu salake sāngyu; <RHYME_27>
Bahu bandhūku ne kok bāṇ, chakra chīpiyā līdhā chhe pāṇ.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The summary is: A husband's anger is like a sharp sword that cuts deep, and his patience is like the gentle touch of a lotus leaf.

transliteration.couplet:
Parshu trishūḷ barachhiyo laī, janjāḷyo ādye shastra chhe kaī; <RHYME_28>
Ati shūrā ichchhe nitya yudha, keṭalāk na rākhe āyudh.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a warrior who is eager to engage in eternal battles and doesn't keep their weapons out of use. Their desire for constant combat is like an unrelenting fire that cannot be extinguished.

transliteration.couplet:
Keṭalāk tyāgī tap karatā, keṭalāk saumya vesh dharatā; <RHYME_29>
Kaulārṇav granth vānche nitye, pūje Shakti Bhairavne prītye.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The ascetic renounces worldly desires and takes on a gentle form, while devotionally worshiping the divine power of Shakti Bhairava with the sacred texts.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā dīṭhā chhe Nāthe apār, mahāpāprūp bhūmibhār; <RHYME_30>
Tiyā rahyā pote avināsh, karavā evā asurno nāsh.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: This couplet describes the magnificence of God's creation and the importance of humility in the face of nature's power. Despite being mortal, we should recognize our limitations and not overstep our bounds.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ potāthī na thāy rati, kā je rākhe chhe ahinsāvṛutti; <RHYME_31>
Besī rahyā vichārī e vidh, tyāre loke jāṇyā chhe ā siddha.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The couplet emphasizes the importance of non-violence and self-control, encouraging one to maintain peace even when provoked. It also suggests that such a path is achievable through contemplation and understanding, leading to inner fulfillment.

transliteration.couplet:
Em jāṇīne pūchhe chhe jeh, kahe Hari thāy tem teh; <RHYME_32>
Tyāre lokne āvī pratītya, lāve anna vastra dravya nitya.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: Those who know the truth ask what is this, says Lord Hari in reply; They take birth again and again, taking their body and clothes with them.

transliteration.couplet:
Teh māyalu kāī na liye, bhūt bhaviṣhyanu kahī diye; <RHYME_33>
Em karatā te ek dan, āvyā pāsaḷe asur jan.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: One should not worry about the past or future, but instead focus on the present moment. Even if you make a small good deed, it will save you from the clutches of evil in the afterlife.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe karya amāru tu kāj, lāvya jaḷ indhaṇā samāj; <RHYME_34>
Daī ḍāro ne bahu ḍarāvyā, na karavānā kām karāvyā.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: When someone does a great deed, it's considered a social gathering; their family and friends praise them highly, but they don't get tired of fame.

transliteration.couplet:
Kare kām Jaḍbharat jem, tyāre bījā kem karo em; <RHYME_35>
Taiye te shu bolyā krodh karī, eno pakṣha melo parharī.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: Work hard and earn wealth in this world, but don't let greed consume you. Be mindful of your ego and temper, lest it destroy you.

transliteration.couplet:
Em vadatā paḍyo virodh, māhomāhi upanyo karodh; <RHYME_36>
Pachhī temā paḍyā taḍ behu, nindā paraspar kare tehu.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: When differences arise between two people, they often magnify their issues through gossip; later, both parties suffer from the negative impact of their own words.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā bandhāṇu ver, ichhyā māravā nahi jene mer; <RHYME_37>
Pratham to bolī ṭholī thaī, pachhī ūṭhyā laṭhā moṭā laī.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that just as a tied thread can't be untied without knowing the knot, similarly one's past actions have consequences and can't be undone without facing their repercussions.

transliteration.couplet:
Līdhī laḍavā pahelī lākaḍī, te to paraspar bahu paḍī; <RHYME_38>
Pachhī līdhā khānḍā kar māy, āvyā sām-sāmā maḷī dhāy.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: Life's ups and downs are like a game of dice, where each throw is uncertain and unpredictable. In this rollercoaster ride, one must learn to balance and adapt with the twists and turns that come along.

transliteration.couplet:
Nākhe barchhiyo bahu sām-sāmī, chāle luvāgyu na rahe khāmī; <RHYME_39>
Salake sāngya ne saṇeṇe tīr, laḍe māhomāhe shūrvīr.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context:
Life's troubles come and go evenly, don't let failures stay; 
Even if the arrow pierces deep, one's sorrow will eventually subside.

transliteration.couplet:
Kare parshunā bahu prahār, nākhe dhokā chharā ne kaṭār; <RHYME_40>
Tīkhā trishūḷ chāle tyā ghaṇā, kare ghā chakra chīpiyā taṇā.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: A person's reputation is ruined after several hours of gossip and rumor spreading. Their good name is destroyed like a spinning wheel that has broken down.

transliteration.couplet:
Bandhūko janjāḷyo kok bāṇ, nākhe māhomāhe asurāṇ; <RHYME_41>
Em jore manḍāṇu chhe yudh, pāmyā trās ākāshe vibudh.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The summary is: One's close friends are like thorns that pierce the heart, and strangers are like demons; while in a battle of wits, one's own mind can be the most terrifying opponent.

transliteration.couplet:
Bāje ḍhol nagārā jujāryo, chāye sām-sāmī taravāryo; <RHYME_42>
Turī raṇshingā bole shankh, paḍe pāpīnā māthā asankhya.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The drums of joy echo through the streets, while the gentle breeze whispers sweet nothings; The conch shell's mighty roar thunders against the countless sins that need to be washed away.

transliteration.couplet:
Machyo yuddha rahī nahi maṇā, paḍyā pṛuthivīe dhaḍ ghaṇā; <RHYME_43>
Tene dekhī harakhyā mānsārī, kahe khāshu āj khūb karī.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The struggle is over and the earth has been conquered, but I still look up to my God-given will; Now, let me know what you want me to do well today.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhūt pret ne āvyā bhairav, pishāch yakṣha rākṣhas sarva; <RHYME_44>
Ḍākaṇī shākaṇī ne jogaṇī, āvī bhūkhī bhairaviyo ghaṇī.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: All supernatural beings like demons and spirits are afraid of the goddess Bhairavi. The hungry Bhairavi is feared by all creatures from the forest and the jungle.

transliteration.couplet:
Kank kāg ne vaḷī kūtarā, thaī gṛudhra shiyāḷ ne sarā; <RHYME_45>
Paḍyā māthā pṛuthvī par raḍe, jāṇyu daitya ramī gayā daḍe.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A bird's nest is hidden on the ground, while a tiger's lair is revealed in the sky; the world is turned upside down. The earth trembles with fear as the gods rejoice and dance at the chaos.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaiknā hāth pag kapāṇā, kaik nāshī bhāgīne chhapāṇā; <RHYME_46>
Em yuddha thayu bahu perya, dash-sahasra gayā Yam gherya.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: In this couplet, the speaker describes two types of people: those who hold onto their wealth and status tightly (like a hawk grasping its prey), and those who flee from the consequences of their actions like a deer running away in fear.

transliteration.couplet:
Eṭalā to iyā taḷ rahyā, bījā nāshī bhāgī paṇ gayā; <RHYME_47>
Te to desh-pradeshe pravarī, bījā daityo āge vāt karī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The summary is: A seed that doesn't yield fruit is like a traveler who returns empty-handed, having gained nothing from their journey. Just as the weather determines the success of a sowing, one's actions determine the outcome of one's endeavors.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahyu ek hato nāno bāḷ, tene jāṇatā ame dayāḷ; <RHYME_48>
Tene arthe vadhiyo virodh, muvā māhomāhi karī krodh.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: A small person's loud voice can be intimidating, but it's just ignorance and cruelty; they argue for their own interests, leading to anger and animosity.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre asur boliyā em, ene oḷakhīye ame kem; <RHYME_49>
Tyāre kahyu āpīe endhāṇ, teṇe paḍe tamane pechhāṇ.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares the wicked words of others to a sharp thorn that pierces deep, and one should beware of those who speak ill behind their back.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati tyāgī tapasvī chhe tane, nathī lobhāto nārī ne dhane; <RHYME_50>
Rahe chhe samādhimā dinrāt, vaḷī jāṇe chhe mannī vāt.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: A woman who has renounced worldly attachments and desires is like a mountain, untouched by the winds of passion; she remains in a state of spiritual calmness, her mind free from distractions.

transliteration.couplet:
Ethī paḍyo paraspar bhed, thayo teṇe āpaṇo uchchhed; <RHYME_51>
Māṭe maḷe to melavo nahi, evī vāt asurne kahi.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: Two people's differences tear them apart, just like a sharp blade cuts through tender grass. Just as the wind doesn't blow without reason, similarly, there is no unnecessary conflict between two individuals.

transliteration.couplet:
Evu suṇīne bolyā asur, have gotshu ene jarūr; <RHYME_52>
Jo maḷashe to mārashu chhaḷe, em bandhāṇu ver saghaḷe.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: When troubles arise, we must endure them with patience; only then can we break free from the bond that holds us back.

transliteration.couplet:
Em daitye karyu pariyāṇ, tene jāṇe chhe Hari sujāṇ; <RHYME_53>
Kahe chhe jem thashe tem ṭhīk, nathī ātmāne kenī bīk.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: When I engage in worldly deeds, God is always pleased with me; He knows my heart and intentions are pure. The world may praise or blame me, but ultimately, it's my own self that truly matters.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahī joyu tatkhev, dīṭhā daivī sampattinā jīv; <RHYME_54>
Tene pote updesh āpī, karyā sukhī bhavdukh kāpī.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: One should strive for spiritual wealth (sampattina) in this life; follow your conscience and take action, finding happiness or unhappiness according to the fruit of your deeds.

transliteration.couplet:
Ā je Hari-charitra anup, Kṛuṣhṇa-bhaktane chhe sukhrūp; <RHYME_55>
Tene kaheshe sāmbhaḷshe jeh, mahākaṣhṭathī mukāshe teh.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: One who has not read the story of Lord Krishna's life is lacking in devotion to Him; such a person's face will be pale and sorrowful.

transliteration.couplet:
Ā lokmā paṇ sukhī raheshe, parloke paramsukh leshe; <RHYME_56>
Pāpharṇī kathā chhe pavitra, jemā prakaṭ Prabhunā charitra.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context:
One's inner peace comes from being in harmony with the universe, and a virtuous story is like a sacred biography revealed by God.

In this world, a pure narrative (story) exists, which is revealed by Lord Krishna Himself.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta hashe te suṇashe bhāve, abhaktane arth nahī āve; <RHYME_57>
Kaheshe hete sāmbhaḷshe kān, te par rājī thāshe Bhagwān.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The devout one is consumed by devotion and listens to the divine, while an unfaithful person does not achieve their purpose; The wise one speaks with humility and waits for the Lord's approval.
